website_summaries.verdict: A sleek, easy-to-use hands-free design that tops the list for its capacity and odor-control capabilities.
pros: Features a no-touch foot pedal opening and Arm & Hammer odor control cartridges
Boasts large capacity that holds more than 100 newborn diapers
cons: At over 12 pounds, it's the heaviest model we reviewed, but this is a small concern considering the quality

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, gross, not worth price
customer_reviews.text: While it traps the smell, so did my diaper genie. I hate having to push dirty pooped in diapers through the hole instead of just dropping it in. It's gross. Plus the step pedal only open the top, you have to force it shut.Forget about using it in the middle of the night because it's extremely loud both when you open it and close it... It wakes up my twins. The front door also doesn't stay shut and pops open whenever you shut the door.
customer_reviews.author: Twinamama

customer_reviews.title: Locks in smell, easy to use. DIY refills with regular garbage bags to save money.
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper pail. We used to use a regular garbage can until starting solids, when the smell was just too much. This container really does lock the smell in, and it's easy to use. The proprietary bag refills are insanely expensive and a total ripoff. You can DIY them yourself. Just buy high quality, Arm and Hammer scented drawstring garbage bags, tighten the drawstring, and feed it into the refill ring and secure it. Works perfectly and holds WAY more diapers and is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: *updated after 10 months’ use* At first we liked this diaper pail. The thing itself is pretty huge compared to other diaper pails we’ve used. (We’ve used a diaper genie and the older style munchkin pail in the past.) I have 2 babies in diapers and I have to change the bag almost daily. Seeing the large size of the diaper pail I expected it to hold more than it does. Now we’ve had it for almost a year and it doesn’t twist the bag shut anymore when you close the lid, so it doesn’t really enclose the smell. It also makes an awful cranking noise whenever you open or close the lid. Disappointed in the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most Important:  DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item yesterday, assembled it today. It's going back on Monday. The top plastic closure tht you're supposed to push a diaper through is so tiny that the only diaper that one could push into it without getting your hand wet or (God forbid) dirty, would be a diaper of a very, very, tiny doll. I can't imagine being able to push a diaper of any size for a human infant through this opening and then pull your hand back out. Whoever designed this thing had no idea what they were doing.
customer_reviews.author: Danade

customer_reviews.title: Foot pedal and easy changing make this the best bet
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite. I have a diaper genie as well and like this SO much more. The foot pedal makes it easy to open when you're holding a baby. The storage capacity is great and has been especially appreciated when friends with babies have come to visit and there are two diapered babes in the house. I also love that the front swings open to take the used diapers out. Much easier than the diaper genie that has to fold in half.
customer_reviews.author: Jen R

customer_reviews.title: Unscented should be an option
customer_reviews.text: There’s really no excuse for this product to only come in lavender scent. Not everybody wants to cover up one smell with another smell, when the product is supposed to seal out smells anyway. They sell unscented bags and you can buy unscented pucks from 3rd parties, but it’s irrelevant because the product that comes in the box already reeks like lavender.
customer_reviews.author: SoxFan82

customer_reviews.title: I'm using this to dispose of dog poo bags after ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to dispose of dog poo bags after we clean up after the pets. It really keeps the smell out of the garage until it's trash day. It appears to be a solid quality product, and it does everything it advertised. No complaints, and I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not a true STEP pail.
customer_reviews.text: Since this is a STEP pail, I assumed once I removed my foot from the step it would close on its own but sadly, it does not. You must push the diaper down in the bag & then close the lid with your hand. (Hence minus one star) Also the door to change the bags isn’t very sturdy. However it does contain odors very well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but eventually stopped spinning so the diapers don't get sealed in. Less than a year after purchasing this diaper pail, it's useless. Such a shame because the previous version worked so well. I wish we would have gone with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: It will do.
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used this product for about 2 months. It's been good about keeping out smell. It's easy to use. The most annoying thing about it though is that any time you step to open it or go to move it, the door opens and you have to slam it shut. May not seem like a big deal, but change multiple diapers on the daily and it gets irritating. I also dont like that a toddler can open it. And if the bug door is left open, some smell is released. So. Meh. I'm not impressed but it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Ph

customer_reviews.title: After few weeks, smells like hell, not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: Well, first weeks were great, and it did its job well. Now however closing the lid doesn't seal the bag properly (using recommended bags and odor mask thingy) and each time we open the diaper pail, the bathroom is filled with very bad smell. Worse than actually having a normal trash and closing the bag with our hands... So our unit is probably broken, but we give 1 star because we feel it's not durable, and don't like spending 70$ for a diaper pail that smell so bad.
customer_reviews.author: gogo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Diaper Disposal
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this diaper pail. I've had other pails in the past but they've all released stink. We have been keeping this diaper pail in our bedroom since our son was born and it's kept our room fresh while being super convenient, especially when we're half-asleep. I've noticed several other reviews complaining that pushing the diapers through the top causes poop to get on one's hands, but I wrap my diapers tightly in themselves when I toss them, so I haven't had any issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: We installed the basement correctly, by leaving plenty tail sitting on the bottom of the bin, but it just won't twist closed. We use an ubbi for poop and diaper genie for pee, so I was hoping to cut out having to use two pails, but this one is as useless as the diaper genie in containing the smell. If there are more than five size four diapers, it will not twist closed. It will work if I replace the bad daily, but what's the point in that? Ended up eating a ton of bag when cutting and tying a new knot. Idk if ours is defective or this is the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S.

customer_reviews.title: I do have one for my daughters room at it is a great pail. This one I ordered off warehouse deals ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned, items gear to close it was broken. I do have one for my daughters room at it is a great pail. This one I ordered off warehouse deals and it was not worth the savings since it didn’t even work.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this thing zero stars, I would. Giving this one star is an insult to the number 1. It has the stupid rotary function that doesn’t accomplish anything other than making it difficult to close the lid....thus giving your baby’s room plenty of odor that this item (I think) was designed to prevent. It seemed like a simple gear mechanism was driving this “feature”, so I took the thing apart to try to disable it. To its credit, this thing is indestructible.....it’s nearly impossible to access the little gear that makes lid closure next to impossible. This item is now in a landfill because it was very poorly made. Thanks a lot, The Earth
customer_reviews.author: Jamie O

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at keeping smell down
customer_reviews.text: This beats the UBBI by a mile! My son had/has an ubbi because everyone talked about how awesome it was they didn’t need special bags. It never kept down the scent enough. This is amazing! Even without the arm and hammer insert (which is amazing) this Keeps the smell down amazingly because it really seals the diapers down.
customer_reviews.author: Marlissa

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT stop bad smell!
customer_reviews.text: The reason we got this was because of the ability to stop the smell. Well that is false! One poop diaper and the entire nursery smells like a freshly used bathroom even with a puck inside the container and in the lid. So for us it will be used as the pee bin and we have the poop bin (diaper genie) in the garage for the smelly ones. I wish someone would make a diaper pale that worked on smell. Or maybe we just have a kid with special poop smell abilities? But this pale does not stop any smell and the pucks hardly smell themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No dirty diaper smell anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Diaper Dekor pail. It was a great pail but as my daughter got older I started to notice the pail smelled more and more. No matter how much I cleaned it and how frequently I changed the bag, it just smelled like a fresh poo. The smell always lingered. This new pail is amazing. I smell nothing! I use the arm & hammer puck and will continue to do so because this thing really works! It seals in the odor and somehow does not escape. So glad I decided to make the change! Telling all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: LuMcD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfect condition and seems to do what its suppose to. Most people say it dosent contain the smell, which is pretty silly it does a good job! It must be the reviewers first child because any parent knows baby poop is beyond potent and honestly I dont think anything in this world can contain that smell 100%. I really like this diaper trash can and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ely

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the best pail
customer_reviews.text: I personally like this over the diaper genie which I had for my first son. Although this is smaller that the genie. But as far as order illumination this one works. No order at all even when you open the top. I had the genie from 10 yrs ago so maybe the design is different now but I think the twisting the bag and the baking soda air freshener is what does the trick. Plus it doesn’t need to be bigger so it can be changed more frequently to lessen odor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper pail! I’ve dealt with the diaper genie before, and this BY FAR is wayyyy better! It is easier to handle, way sturdier, super easy to take out bag and put new one in, holds up better and is designed way better looks wise! We have had it for almost a year now, and have not yet to smell a stench from it! The diaper genie reeks after a few months, No matter if you change the bags or not! The little arm and hammer attachment disc is awesome and I love it! Super happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Locks in the smell like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, simple to refill, and locks in the smell perfectly. Only minor complaints are 1) the lid has to be pushed closed, and 2) it has to be emptied pretty frequently - wish it used the space more efficiently. (The bag tends to spiral as it's filled and therefore must be emptied more often than it could be if it filled like a traditional trash can.) Love how fresh it makes my LO's nursery smell!
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Great Design, Great Function
customer_reviews.text: After comparing several different variants of the diaper pail concept on the shelves of our local baby mega-store, including the original Diaper Genie, we liked the design concept of the Munchkin. When we got it and put it into its proper home in our baby's nursery, we saw how truly brilliant this design is. The mechanism inside which spins the disposable bag works wonderfully and smoothly, and the bags are incredibly easy to replace. What's even better, the design is sleek and smooth. Nothing about this screams 'diaper pail' making it especially inconspicuous.
customer_reviews.author: Nadina Williams-Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time figuring out how to change the bag... I found instructions online. Other than that, I give this product an A+. I don't use it for diapers, I use it for dog pads, as my pet is paper trained. I used to just put used pads in a bag and then into the garbage... but the garbage stank pretty seriously. Now with my Munchkin, there is never an issue of foul odors. I really love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Winter

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Okay we have now purchased two of these diaper pail systems (one for upstairs and one for downstairs). So far I love it! We have smelled NOTHING! Easy to change. Love the individual bags. They snap close and you take it out. So much better than our past diaper genie! Oh, I even got these in the open box- excellent condition options- saved about $10 bucks each one- extremely happy with my overall purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tammyoeo

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: So got this diaper pale based on all the good reviews. Pro: It is very large so you don't have to take it out all the time but it still locks the smell in really well. Con: It is horribly loud! The lid does not close on its own you gave to push it down and it makes a decent amount of noise. When it is getting full it get even louder. Not ideal for a sleeping baby in the same room. I would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: K.Hildreth

customer_reviews.title: Get this diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than other brands out there. This is our second one (for a different area of the house not because the first failed). It contains small 100%, it looks so much nicer than other brands (you dont even notice it in the room), it's very easy to clean, and the step peddle is very necessary while holding a baby and a dirty diaper. I prefer the individual refill bags to the tie off kind, but that's just me. The lavender smelly pod is a great bonus every time you open the pail.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs.

customer_reviews.title: Munchkin takes care of their customers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best diaper pail. I love how easy it is to empty. I also love the size. It holds a good amount of diapers so you aren't always emptying. We have two in diapers and this is perfect! Update: One year later, the lid won’t close all the way letting the smell out. I contacted Munchkin and they sent me a FREE replacement right away. I’m still very happy with the product and even happier knowing that the company will help me out if their product fails.
customer_reviews.author: Katie N.

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is really great. However it twists closed to keep odors in... but unless it has a certain amount of weight (diapers) in the bag, the part that "twists" closed will open when you shut the lid. This is not a problem right now but probably will be with a toddler. This is the second one we've had to do this by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Avan01

customer_reviews.title: Door won't stay closed, only accepts branded pail refills.
customer_reviews.text: No other diaper pail bags will seem to fit this pail despite both the pail and the bags claiming they do. Works well enough but the door to where the diapers go keeps popping open. Also quite loud and wakes mommy up when I change baby's diaper unless I go out of the way to open and close it gently (guiding the lid up and down with my hand, skipping the foot pedal feature which slams the lid open)
customer_reviews.author: Taeloth

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Scent goes away really quickly and it's hard to find them in stores. Doesn’t quite do the job of masking the dirty diaper smell. I would stick to a normal trash can as the refills are outrageously expensive for something that doesn’t work very well. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: If you buy the singe bags then they are a ...
customer_reviews.text: If you buy the singe bags then they are a little too short so the bag gets heavy and weighs down the top. When that happens then the smell escapes a little bit. Buy the pull through bags that way you can make the length you need.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Four years later with 3 kids total I feel like one should of held up longer than just 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: My first born was born 4.5 years ago. We got our first Munchikin then. Since then we have gone through 4. Four years later with 3 kids total I feel like one should of held up longer than just 9 months. The more expensive I felt the models got the cheaper they felt and the quicker they fell apart. With our last child now 20 months old I am hesitant to buy yet another one (number 5) to just potty train him hopefully within the next 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Sims

customer_reviews.title: Risky blade in the center
customer_reviews.text: So I was very excited to get the updated version of my sons diaper pail which is this one bc of how nice it looks and the added safety features. However once I started using it the doors clearly had something wrong with them they would not stay closed allowing smells into my room since that’s where we have baby for now . Also I was afraid that bc the door in the front would not remain closed my son could get injured with the blade that is in the center to cut the trash bags . So thank you but I can’t risk it had to return made me nervous 😬.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Completely odorless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister when she had her daughter last year and it’s awesome. A smell has never escaped this thing. Highly recommend so you’re not constantly running poopy diapers to the outside garbage can. The only thing you want to be sure of is that you achieve a good solid wrap with the dirty diaper since you do have to squish it into the opening.
customer_reviews.author: Aislyn

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: If you have babies this is a must have. It’s very easy to use and helps you to keep your bedroom smelling nice. It comes with a couple of replacement bags and it smells very good. It keeps the diaper smell inside.
customer_reviews.author: Dariel Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Ick
customer_reviews.text: I hate having to stick my hand through the hole with a wet (or worse) diaper! So gross. Also have challenges getting bags in and top put back on, plastic is very stiff and clicks like I may break it.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Not for multi-kid families
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product but I just cant recommend for a family with 3 kids (5,3, and 1) It only allows (approximately)one column of diapers into the garbage sack, so I’m constantly changing it with 3 kids in diapers. Every other day, if not daily. You have to push the diaper into the opening getting contents of diaper gushing out. This helps with smell (because the opening is small) but it make you get poop on your hands or on the garbage sack when you have a full diaper...not a pleasant experience. Very good containing smell.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Sucks. Will return!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact it was super easy to setup. Almost zero setup! The spinning mechanism doesn't hold the bag closed! It just opens right back up letting all of the foul scents back into my face when I open the lid. Now I can smell it with the lid closed also. I have literally had it for about 2 days and I hate it already!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for <2 yrs.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while. It had good odor control when it is fully closed. Sometimes the lid wouldn’t fully close and odor would escape. It also broke in < 2yrs. Now the mechanism won’t twist the bag closed when the lid closes. If you get this, I do recommend buying the off brand bags from amazon. They’re cheaper and worked just as well. Overall it worked, but it had a short life so I will not be buying this one again.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: Good for people who don’t mind some poop on their hands.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty design, but was not practical for anybody who does not like to push their hand through poop and urine smeared plastic. The ratchet mechanism on the lid is very weak and struggles to twist as the diaper pale approaches full forcing you to leave the lid up. Overall controlled scent well though when it could close completely. Would not recommend in its current state. If there was a mechanism that pushed the diaper through the twist it would not be so bad, but not for people who don’t like to touch old poop.
customer_reviews.author: John Z Gallien

customer_reviews.title: Still Stinky
customer_reviews.text: So I read every review I could find, googled “best diaper pails” etc. This Munchkin was at the top of every list. Really? Cause it’s mediocre! Does not block odors well. Maybe it’s because the lid doesn’t automatically close!! Really?! It’s for diapers- I’m already short handed! This requires you push the lid closed every time! Baby is almost 8 months old, still mostly breastfed- so we haven’t even got to the serious stinky diapers yet. Honestly, even with lid closed, I can still smell the stinky diaper- and have to change the bag to take it out of the house. I’m trying the hands free Dekor plus next- at least the lid shuts automatically.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: Great trash can, but not good for cloth diapers. The diapers fit into the slot, but this holds the odor and unleashes all of it when opened. I needed to remove the orange plastic piece for the bags in order to fit cloth bags inside, unfortunately was not the best investment for our needs. Just use a large wet bag with a drawstring or zipper instead.
customer_reviews.author: Detronyx

customer_reviews.title: Great for Birds too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for when I clean my birdcage. My African Grey Parrot throws fruit and fresh food onto his tray that attracts insects and horrible odor; thus I needed a solution to lock in odor while tight sealing the garbage. The pet containers are great but not large enough, so I opted for a diaper container. I would recommend this product for bird or pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Krupa

customer_reviews.title: WATCH OUT!!! LITTLE FINGERS CAN GET STUCK IN FOOT PEDAL!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this diaper pail today and within minutes of heeding it up and in the babys room my son smashed his finger in the foot pedal. He was able to push the foot pedal down and his index finger got caught between the pedal and pail. So far I'm not liking this pail too much. Aside from the fact that my son hurt himself I also am unsure of having to push the dirty diaper through the hole so it can catch the mechanism. This is are first time having a diaper pail and so far I am not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail works just as described. Easy to use, masks the smell of a full load of diapers and holds so so many diapers at once. I’ve seen other complaints about having to close the lid by hand...this has not been an issue after 4 months of use. You need to push the lid down in order to activate the sealed closing of the liner bag. The refill bags are easy to insert as well. I’d recommend this for all new moms!
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't contain the smell. YUCK
customer_reviews.text: This newly designed pail, although more attractive, is vastly inferior to the old design. And when it comes to diaper pails, functionality trumps all. This does not contain the smell at all and the spinning mechanism meant to close the top of the bag and contain yucky smells broke leaving our entire first floor reaking of diaper. I had to throw the whole thing away. Of course, the other 2 Arm & Hammer pails that are the OLD design are still working well and doing their jobs. Very disappointed in this redesign and wish the older model was still available.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 different brands of diaper bins this being my 3rd and I love it! The first 2 broke and still had a bad smell anytime I threw a poopy diaper away but this one has been perfect so far, no bad smell and so easy to use, the best bags to use are the 7-layer bags lavender scent so convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Warda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item thinking it was the best diaper pail on the market. The reviews were both good and bad but the good outweighed the bad. Turns out this is the worst diaper pail. It works no better than a regular trash can with a lid. I replace the bag often and it still has a terrible smell. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Good diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: Good diaper pail and worth the money..so far. Package came severely damaged and actually had a small scratch on the actual pail. I do like the way the bag twists itself to close however the actual lid does not “seal” like you think it would when it shuts..or maybe mine was actually damaged/loosened from the shipping damage.
customer_reviews.author: AusDarHam

customer_reviews.title: Great pail but could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: Very modern looking diaper pail, definitely better looking than most of the other ones on the market. It’s a great improvement over their original model which I replaced with this one. It takes a lot of different types of refill bags. The only thing that I don’t like is that it’s not childproof at all. My one year old figured out how to open and unlock the diaper pail after having it for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, no smell!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! So easy to use and keeps the smell out of my baby's room. We were just using a garbage can before which was awful unless you took it out everyday. With the lavender bags and lavender puck, I never smell any of his diapers. And it holds almost a week's worth of diapers, just depending on how many diapers. When it does start to get full it'll be harder to close, so just take it out. Pushing the diaper in isn't that bad, I just take a wipe and wrap it up and push it down. The foot pedal is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our third try at a diaper pail and this one ...
customer_reviews.text: Our third try at a diaper pail and this one contains the stink! 4 stars because you have to buy refills of everything but it is worth the fresh smelling nursery.
customer_reviews.author: Emily M Cascarina

customer_reviews.title: Designers did not go far enough
customer_reviews.text: First, let me start with the packaging. You need at least ten minutes to get it out of the box. If you decide to return it, another 15 minutes to figure out how the packaging goes together again. Second, you have to manually push down the lid after you open it. And, if you place the can against a wall, the lid hinge will scuff your paint when you open the can. The hinge sticks out behind the can, ergo no ability to place flush to the wall. I did not even test it. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: We love this diaper pail and that it fits our old arm and hammer bags that we have a ton of. Bought this when the arm and hammer broke and this is so much more aesthetically pleasing that our old one. We also put a baby proofing latch on it to keep the toddler out, otherwise they can just open it and stick their hand right in. Would be nice if they eventually designed it with a child lock in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea S.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but doesn’t last nearly as long as the older ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work for very long. The first one I ordered stopped sealing off the diapers in the first few days. Amazon replaced it and the second one has made it few months but now has the same problem and won’t close. Looks nice but doesn’t last nearly as long as the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy compared to other brands available. Holds a lot of diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase and I’m glad I went with this brand as I read reviews of another brand that the bag needs to be changed frequently. Can holds a lot of diapers and we didn’t have to change it until 4-5 days of a lot of newborn diapers. No smell in the room, but again breastfeeding and newborn diapers don’t have much smell.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is even better than my old Diaper Genie Elite, and I loved that thing so that's saying something! Controls the odors very well, even easier than the Elite to open/cut/throw away bags, and is a good height for one-handed operation. I don't care for the scented bags but they do work well without tearing and if you're into lavender scent it's pretty pleasant and not overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: VenaKava

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. We were having issues with our diaper genie, and got to the point where it just broke. Decided to read up and chose this product Let me tell you, you have no idea that there is a big pile of stinky diapers in the room! It is great and super handy. My only two (small) complaints are the lid is not self closing and the front bin sometimes gets wonky trying to latch.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Shapland

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The pail, first of all, is lovely (for a diaper pail, lol). Very sleek and inconspicuous. The refill bag inserts are super easy to replace, and, once the pail is full, the bags are easy to cut and tie off! Really does prevent the room from smelling like one big dirty diaper! One of our favorite baby purchases, for sure! I could keep going on and on about this diaper pail, but suffice it to say that you just need to go ahead and purchase one. It will make your life SO MUCH EASIER!
customer_reviews.author: Callie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Top too easy to open
customer_reviews.text: After many years of use by multiple children, our diaper pail finally broke. I was happy to get a new upgraded diaper pail. However, I was disappointed that the top on this diaper pail is so easy for my one year old to open, so it’s another thing I have to be vigilant about keeping him away from, when I would like his room to be as baby proofed as possible. This is a disappointing oversight for a baby product.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Other moms told me not to worry about getting this BUT boy were they wrongggg!! Love this to keep baby’s stinky diapers contained. Easy to change, looks great in nursery and most of all there’s no smell! So much better than dropping stinky diapers in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Becca Prebeg

customer_reviews.title: The self-sealing was broken after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail worked great at the beginning, no odor at all. But this only lasted for about one and half year, and then there's something wrong with the twisting gear as we can hear a friction sound there. I guess it's because we use the refill bags which are more difficult to seal when they are almost full. I think the refill rings may be more friendly for this pail.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be more reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best diaper pail out there, but we had to buy a second one since the plastic gears inside did not close the bag any longer. The inside gears are really cheap. When it works it does keep most of the smell manageable. I would recommend always pushing the diaper all the way in (below the inner basket) and closing the lid softly to keep this working longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Neil

customer_reviews.title: this is the best one. Although the gear on the first one ...
customer_reviews.text: of all the diaper pails out there, this is the best one. Although the gear on the first one we had wore out so it would stop spinning after about a year,. I think we tried to force it closed when it was overfull one too many times Pro: air tight, strong plastic Con: The gear that spins the bag closed/open on lid closing wore out after about a year
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Murray

customer_reviews.title: Like everything except, I hate you have to use your hands to close the lid EVERY TIME!
customer_reviews.text: the lid is prob super dirty as you can open it with foot but you HAVE to close the lid with hand. So do you close it right after dropping the diaper or do you do it after washing your hands. Either way is not an ideal solution. For the price paid, it should really have a better solution here.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Almost guys. Make the recepticle hole BIGGER!
customer_reviews.text: If you like scraping your entire hand in the sides of the hole that the dirty diaper just left germs and poop on to shove the diaper down the hole, then this is for you. If you'd rather never touch the dirty diaper hole and not have to wash up to your forearms then don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: C. F. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: With regular but gentle use, it stopped spinning and stopped closing in less than a year. Considered buying another one because we like how tall it is but I plan on having more kids and don’t want to buy one yearly at this price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design but missing the basic.: Odor trap.
customer_reviews.text: I have the diaper pail, the classic and plastic one and this new one. I was hoping this one to be better as it’s sippoed to twist the bag when is closing but didn’t work better than the old classic one. Looks great but is missing the mos important part. Odor trap. Also the twist of the bag is done buy the mechanical force when you close the lid so it’s not always happening as the bag gets heavier with diapers in.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is great! It really controls the odor of the diapers and holds a lot of diapers. The peddle is handy, but half the time we just lift the lid up. The extra odor protection of the lavender puck is really nice and the twisting action of the bag really helps too. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Marie

customer_reviews.title: Controls smells
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pale is fantastic. I don't have experience with others, but we read a lot of reviews before choosing this and we're glad we did. The only con is having to squeeze a diaper through the opening, but that same mechanism is how the pale controls bad smells so it's worth it. You can buy generic bags that are cheaper and unscented too.
customer_reviews.author: New Cleats

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So easy to open with my foot and drop diapers in. My only problem with every diaper pail I've had/seen is that they don't lock. Idk about a everyone else but my 15 month old is determined to stuff as many blocks in there as possible. Absolutely horrible experience to reach in and dig them out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Ubbi we bought and broke after less ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Ubbi we bought and broke after less than a year! This one masks the smell so much better and seems like it will last longer too. My only gripe is that the suction that keeps the bag closed and smell out also makes it difficult to discard anything other than diapers (e.g. Dirty wipes/tissues) so it's good to also have a regular waste basket nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kiely

customer_reviews.title: Smell
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work. I run a daycare and after my 10hr shift is done it reeeeeaaks. I am doing everything right and even put the stinky diapers in another bag before putting it in there though the tiny hole. The arm and hammer thing didnt last more than 1 week before the smell was gone and it smelled like poo. So didnt work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great Diaper Destroyer lol
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality! After three babies, it was time for a new can for baby #4. This one way outdoes my last one. Love the foot peddle to open it and love that it does a twist action to the bag when you’re finished. So smart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good diaper pail, without having any to compare it to
customer_reviews.text: This is the only diaper pail we’ve ever used but we like it! It doesn’t smell at all. Functions nicely. It’s gotten off track once where the ring didn’t close with the lid which let smell through but we fixed it easily. We’ve had it for six months so far and are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Scent be gone
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper pail. Mainly got it for the scent and it has done well. Newborn is about 18 days today. Been good so far! Glad I did my research and chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: gabriela negrete

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and no more bad smell
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, contain the smell very well, just be aware the scent cartridge is a big one, not the tiny one with few in the package. The trash bag is thick and no smell leak out. Smell will still leak when opening the lid, but that is acceptable since all pail will do that.
customer_reviews.author: Bing Yiu

customer_reviews.title: a huge disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: attractive and it has a large capacity but the plastic lid closure hinge broke off on the second day! it was highly rated but I now have to spend more money on diaper disposal! a real disappointment! cheryl
customer_reviews.author: cheryl young

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got one for her first baby and has gotten just about two years out of it. It did break (not sure if she over loaded it or not) but she was so happy with it she asked for the same one again for baby #2.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anders

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t decide between this one and a metal one. But metal ones eventually rust and then apparently NOTHING you can do about the smell. This plastic is supposed to be the “good” kind that you can clean. So far so good. Also works very well. Got it for an adult with only bladder incontinence. Works very well for our perpose.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Making diaper changes less miserable
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and to change bags. It works essentially the same as the cat litter genie. I like how we don't need to see dirty diapers when we open the lid, and of course, how we don't need to smell dirty old diapers. We liked it so much that we ordered a second one to put in our family room, where our baby spends most of the day. The material is solid and of good quality. Only complaint is that the refill rings do not last very long and are expensive to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wang

customer_reviews.title: No smells.
customer_reviews.text: A game changer. We wish we would have had this for our first child. It holds many diapers and often we don’t have to empty it but once a week if you use the liner cartridges. These are hard to find I stores though along with the air fresheners that clip in. No smells at all.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Andy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother trying anything else ... this is the perfect diaper pail , no smell whatsoever, brilliant mexhanism to lick each stinky diaper in and economic use of bags because it depends on how many diapers you want to throw ,,, Highly Recommended ! Stat away from Ubbi I almost lost hope because of it until I found Munchkin’s !
customer_reviews.author: Hanin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and controls smell
customer_reviews.text: Had the munchkin diaper pail with the first kid and it lasted a couple years. Had to replace the pail because we had a newborn on the way, and something in the mechanism had broke so it wasn’t closing properly. Love the step feature of this one. So much easier than the original pail. Also love that you can use multiple types of bags in it. FYI diaper genie inserts don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well at First - Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: It worked great at first, but before we had even had it a year, the spinning/twisting mechanism that is supposed to happen when you close the lid, thus sealing the bag and keeping in the smell stopped working. So now every time we close the lid, the bags don't twist shut, letting out all of the diaper smell into the room (even with the lid shut). Not to mention it's totally noisy, too, because of this defect. It wasn't initially noisy at all - it's been this way since it stopped spinning. Very disappointed about having to buy another pail, as it's pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: may not be worth the price
customer_reviews.text: At first we really liked this diaper pail then one day the bottom broke out of it. Looks like a hammer was taken to it very odd. And now the door hing is falling off. Not sure if its da defect or just bad luck
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: This works fine so far but our baby hasn't started solids yet ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fine so far but our baby hasn't started solids yet so not sure how well the smells will he contained once the poop gets stinkier. I'm not a huge fan of squishing the diaper into the pail but I guess that's what keeps the smell in.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews before you buy - not worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but just as all the other posts state, eventually you will stop being able to push the lid down all the way and the bag will cease to twist shut, letting the smell out. It’s also very loud now when trying to shut it. We owned the previous model for years and were very pleased, disappointing that it stopped working about 5 months after I bought it, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Id recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my doggys potty pads. Iv had real odor an messy disposal issues. This is wonderful! I wished id gotten one long ago. No smell at all. Easy fast an very clean. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Packard

customer_reviews.title: The absolute BEST!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute BEST for diapers. I love using the refills that are not the SNAP. I am able to throw out the diapers more frequently which reduces the odors. This pail compared to all of the other is #1. Love it! I have two. One upstairs and one downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but noisy!
customer_reviews.text: Works, but is super loud and somewhat difficult to push diapers in to the chute. Often end up getting diaper poop/pee on the lining and therefor on hands when pushing the next diaper in.
customer_reviews.author: featherless

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Features/Odor Reduction
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed. If you want something that fights the smells, this is your answer. We've had both a diaper genie and an Ubbi...the Munchkin beats them hands down in both features and odor suppression. A little pricey, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz B.

customer_reviews.title: It's kind-of just a glorified trash can, but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It's kind-of just a glorified trash can, but it does help hold in some of the stink, and it's very convenient to use -- even when you've only got one hand to use or are running low on energy and brain power. The refill bags don't cost a ton, and you can even buy some that are scented with lavender to cut down on the poop smell a little more. We probably change the lining once a week(ish), and it's been well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: love, love love this
customer_reviews.text: love, love love this! it has eliminated the odor in the bathroom (along with the baking soda cartridge). My niece has another brand and likes mine better. I was concerned the opening wouldn't be big enough to stuff an adult size diaper in but I have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good product, would be even better if the gears ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, would be even better if the gears were not plastic! We still had it even though the stop doesn’t spin to twist the bag. Our gears have been slipping since we’ve had it. I just thought it was noisy. Great idea, it essentially works, but it would be a lot more durable and last longer if the gears were stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: It damages easy and stops working
customer_reviews.text: It started failing soon after bought. Now it doesn’t press the bags and always smells terrible. It is like I’m not using anything to prevent smell. Might as well be without diaper pail
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Not the best one on the market for efficiency...
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to get the diapers into the pail because of how it twists the bag to keep smell out. Trying to force overfilled or dirty diapers through here without getting it on your hands is very unlikely. Not only that but you have to use these arm and hammer hockey puck sent things that only last a week on top of buying more bags. So you are having to continuously spend more money to keep this thing "working".
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: I was at my wits end before I found this!  A+
customer_reviews.text: I use it to throw mom’s incontinence pads in. No odor and only need to empty it when it’s full. Refills are easy to install and reasonably priced. I threw several trash cans away because the urine odor permeated the can and I couldn’t get it out. Also, even with scented bags the odor wasn’t controlled. This “diaper pail” works great. I wish I had found it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Thea

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it to any parents who need to keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: superb product. I would recommend it to any parents who need to keep the air fresh in their apartment or bedroom. I have one of these in my bedroom and I don't detect the faintest odor. Thank you, Munchkin. You saved me from breathing those soil diaper. UPDATE: BROKE by Dec 2019. The top doesn't close anymore so the smelly diaper pungent flavors start to float throughout the room. So technically this diaper pail last for about 18 months and then no more.
customer_reviews.author: Mun Kin Chang

product_meta.title: Munchkin Step Diaper Pail Powered by Arm & Hammer, Includes (1) Bonus Toss Disposable Diaper Pail
product_meta.description: Style:PailThis is the new Gold standard in diaper pails! Step is the only pail that combines best in class odor control with a modern, sleek aesthetic that looks great in any nursery and an easy to use foot pedal. Even better? For every single diaper pail sold, Munchkin will plant a tree! We're on a mission to reduce gassy emissions both inside and outside the nursery. The Step diaper pail works with both refill rings and snap, seal and toss refill bags, the choice is yours! To lock in the stink, the pail relies on the odor busting duo of lavender scented Arm and Hammer baking soda and patented self sealing technology, sealing in odors as the lid closes. Lastly, each Step comes with a Munchkin lavender scented Puck, which continuously absorbs odors while the pail is not in use and keeps your nursery smelling sweet (like babies should!). Additional refills sold separately. This is the perfect pail to have in your Home, and also works as a great registry item! Take a deep breath, because the Munchkin Step Diaper Pail has arrived.
feature_bullets: Proven Number 1 in odor control, Step Diaper Pail keeps your nursery fresh
Awarded 2020 Best Overall Diaper Pail by the Good Housekeeping Institute
Patented self-sealing system keeps odors contained whether lid is open or closed
The only diaper pail compatible with both rings and snap, seal & toss bags
Set contains (1) Step Pail, (1) Snap, Seal and Toss Bag, (1) Starter Ring Refill, (1) Lavender scented baking soda puck and (1) TOSS Disposable Diaper Pail
Get a pail, give a tree. For every STEP Diaper Pail sold, Munchkin will plant a tree
Measures 27” high x 12” deep; comes with step pedal to open hands-free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,348 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
